title: Bolton Indicted, Trump and Zelenskyy Meeting, Rebuilding Gaza

And the scale of Gaza__ reconstruction is staggering, with unexploded bombs buried in the rubble, nearly all buildings damaged or destroyed and major questions about who will lead the reconstruction.Want more comprehensive analysis of the most important news of the day, plus a little fun?Subscribeto the Up First newsletter. It was produced by Ziad Buchh, Nia Dumas and Milton Guevara.

title: Trump and Zelenskyy to meet. And, John Bolton indicted for mishandling classified info
short_opening: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy is expected to meet with President Trump today in the White House for the third time this year. Zelenskyy is seeking long-range weapons that could strike targets deep inside Russia and assistance from the president to secure a ceasefire deal that would benefit Ukraine.
label: Diplomatic Engagements

title: Trump and Zelenskyy meet again
short_opening: In the last few days, President Trump has met separately with the presidents of Russia and Ukraine, in an attempt to break the deadlock and end the war.Today__ meeting at the White House between Trump and Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy seemed to go much better than last time, when Zelenskyy left early after a heated argument in the Oval Office. In fact, Zelenskyy hailed today__ meeting as __he best one_ yet.Even so, the next steps to ending the war are unclear. Russian President Vladimir Putin and Zelenskyy still haven__ met face-to-face to negotiate, and it__ not certain whether they will be able to find common ground.NPR White House correspondent Danielle Kurtzleben gives an update on the day__ events, and former national security adviser Susan Rice gives her perspective on the likelihood of a deal.
label: Diplomatic Engagements
